shortdesc.ph: Enables tracing of the video frame rendering process.
Enables tracing of the video frame rendering process.

section.p: After calling this method, the SDK starts tracing the rendering status of video frames in the channel from the time of the call and reports related information through the callback. You can call this method in conjunction with UI controls in your app (such as buttons or sliders) to optimize user experience. For example, call this method when the user clicks the 'Join Channel' button and use the callback to obtain the time taken for video frame rendering, thereby optimizing related metrics.
After successfully calling this method, the SDK traces the rendering status of video frames in the channel and reports related event information through the callback.

ul.li: If you do not call this method, the SDK starts tracing video rendering events from the moment joinChannel is called. You can call this method at an appropriate time based on your actual application scenario to set the starting point for tracing video rendering events.
After the local user leaves the current channel, the SDK automatically starts tracing video rendering events from the time you joined the channel.
If you do not call this method, the SDK starts tracing video frame rendering events from the time joinChannel is called.
You can call this method at the appropriate time based on your application scenario to set the starting point for tracing video rendering events.
After the local user leaves the current channel, the SDK automatically resumes tracing from the next time the user joins a channel.

section.title: Scenario
section.p: This method is applicable in multi-channel scenarios.
